treatment.reference: Methanobacterium arcticum sp. nov., a methanogenic archaeon from Holocene Arctic permafrost IJSEM 61:144-147
treatment.description: Cells are Gram-negative, non-motile, non-spore-forming, slightly curved rods, 0.45–0.50 µm wide and 3.0–6.0 µm long. Often forms filaments and cyst-like coccoid cells. Strictly anaerobic. Chemoautotrophic. Optimal growth at 37 ˚C; maximum temperature is 45 ˚C. Optimal growth at pH 6.8–7.2; no growth at pH 5.0 or 9.0. Utilizes H2/CO2 and formate for growth and methane generation, but not acetate, methanol, ethanol, 2-propanol, 2-butanol, methylamines, methanol/H2 or methylamine/H2. Growth is not stimulated by acetate. The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 38.1 mol%. The type strain M2T (=DSM 19844T =VKM B-2371T) was isolated from Holocene permafrost sediments from the Kolyma lowland, Russia (70u 069 N 154u 049 E).
